macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Major U.S. indexes finish mixed after tech-led volatility
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.9% on Friday, erasing early-week losses, while the Dow gained 0.4% and the Nasdaq climbed 1.3% as AI and big-tech names strengthened late in the session; weekly moves were small with mixed sector leadership amid continued tech volatility.[2][1]

items.title: Weekly recap: S&P and Nasdaq end week modestly lower amid concentrated tech weakness
items.summary: Over the week, the S&P 500 fell nearly 2% and the Nasdaq and Russell 2000 declined close to 3%, with declines concentrated in mega-cap technology, growth, and AI-exposed stocks while equal-weight and value factors outperformed.[1]

items.title: Bank of Japan raises rate to highest in 30 years; Japanese stocks gain
items.summary: The Bank of Japan increased its benchmark interest rate to its highest level in three decades, and Japanese equities closed higher on the move.[2]

items.title: Treasury yields drift lower as markets balance slower growth and easing inflation
items.summary: Treasury markets adjusted to signs of slower but stable growth and easing inflation pressures, sending yields lower as investors weighed a cooling economy against a still-patient Fed; markets continue to price in more rate cuts than the Fed anticipates.[1]

items.title: AI and chip stocks remain under pressure despite late-session bounce
items.summary: AI-related sectors—including chipmakers, cloud providers, and data-center-linked companies—have been underperforming through the week, reflecting concerns over capital spending and near-term profitability despite intermittent rallies such as Nvidia-led gains on Friday.[1][2]

items.title: Corporate winners: Oracle, Winnebago among notable movers
items.summary: Oracle rose sharply after joining a U.S. TikTok joint venture, and Winnebago surged after reporting profits and revenue that beat estimates, helping lift the market late in the session.[2]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto markets rally as CoinDesk 20 constituents all trade higher; SUI and SOL lead gains
items.summary: The CoinDesk 20 index rose 4.6% as all constituents traded higher, led by Sui (SUI) up ~7% and Solana (SOL) up ~6.9%, reflecting broad risk-on flows across large-cap tokens in the past 24 hours.[2]

items.title: Bitcoin and Ether climb after Bank of Japan decision lifts Asian risk appetite
items.summary: Bitcoin and Ether posted gains as markets reacted positively to the BOJ decision, which cleared a macro overhang for Asian risk assets and helped lift crypto prices across the board in the latest session.[3]

items.title: Weekly roundup: regulators, stablecoins, and project roadmaps shape crypto backdrop
items.summary: A broad industry roundup reports a softer Fed stance on bank–crypto engagement, intensified stablecoin competition (including plans for a large USD1 stablecoin), new SEC custody guidance for broker-dealers, and multiple national regulatory moves such as the UK's Cryptoassets Regulations 2025 and Canada's Stablecoin Act—indicating growing regulatory clarity and institutional positioning ahead of 2026.[1]

items.title: Aave unveils 2026 roadmap after SEC closes investigation without enforcement action
items.summary: Aave released its 2026 roadmap following the SEC's decision to close an investigation into the protocol without taking enforcement action, removing a significant regulatory overhang for the DeFi lending protocol.[1]

items.title: Solana weathers record 6 Tbps DDoS without disruption
items.summary: Solana reported successfully absorbing a record 6 terabits-per-second DDoS attack while maintaining 100% validator uptime and normal block processing, marking a notable network resilience event.[1]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AWS re:Invent 2025 Unveils Major AI Advancements Including Amazon Nova 2 and Kiro Agents
items.summary: AWS announced the Amazon Nova 2 model family, Amazon Bedrock AgentCore updates, Kiro autonomous agents with persistent context, Amazon Nova Act for 90%+ reliable browser automation, Reinforcement Fine-Tuning for 66% accuracy gains, and 18 new open weight models. These developments address production-ready AI challenges with innovations like checkpointless training and elastic scaling.

items.title: NDAA Legislation Impacts AI and Cybersecurity with New Pentagon Requirements
items.summary: The National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), dated December 19, 2025, mandates reporting on AI and machine learning systems used within the Pentagon within 180 days of enactment, signaling heightened focus on AI in defense.

items.title: Interview Kickstart Updates Advanced Machine Learning Course with Agentic AI Focus
items.summary: Interview Kickstart's leading Advanced Machine Learning course received an agentic AI update, featuring live online classes taught by FAANG+ AI/ML engineers, announced on December 20, 2025.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Epic Games Store Offers Eternights as Free Game for December 19-20
items.summary: The Epic Games Store is giving away Eternights for free from December 19 to 20, 2025, continuing their daily free game promotion. Recent free titles include Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel (December 18-19) and Hogwarts Legacy (December 11-18).

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

summary:
Here is a concise executive briefing based on the provided raw news and market data:

1. **Market Overview**: The S&P 500 rose 0.9% on Friday, while the Dow gained 0.4% and the Nasdaq climbed 1.3%. The crypto market also rallied, with the CoinDesk 20 index rising 4.6% as all constituents traded higher. Bitcoin and Ether posted gains after the Bank of Japan decision lifted Asian risk appetite. Major indexes finished mixed after tech-led volatility, with AI and big-tech names strengthening late in the session.

2. **Tech & AI**: Notable tech developments include the release of Mistral OCR 3, a new generation of AI-driven global weather models by NOAA, and the announcement of Amazon Nova 2 and Kiro Agents at AWS re:Invent 2025. Additionally, there have been significant advancements in CSS Grid Lanes, Rust's Block Pattern, and the development of Lite^3, a JSON-compatible zero-copy serialization format.

3. **Gaming & Entertainment**: There is no significant gaming news in the provided data.

4. **Key Insights**:
* The crypto market is experiencing a rally, with all CoinDesk 20 constituents trading higher.
* AI and big-tech names are driving market volatility, with significant gains in the Nasdaq.
* Regulatory clarity and institutional positioning are growing in the crypto space, with developments such as the UK's Cryptoassets Regulations 2025 and Canada's Stablecoin Act.
* Significant advancements are being made in AI and machine learning, including new model releases and company announcements.
* The Bank of Japan's decision to raise interest rates has lifted Asian risk appetite, positively impacting crypto prices.

5. **Watch List**: 
Items to monitor in the coming days include the continued impact of the Bank of Japan's decision on crypto prices, the development of new AI models and technologies, and the growth of regulatory clarity in the crypto space. Additionally, keep an eye on the performance of major indexes, particularly the Nasdaq, as AI and big-tech names continue to drive market volatility.
